intro: Romulea alpina, commonly known as the alpine romulea, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rosette-like growth habit. The plant produces striking, bell-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, adapted to withstand cold and arid conditions. Romulea alpina is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, thriving in sunny, well-drained environments.
